pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:0.4: The sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.2: the nuns from the group of six were wearing jewellery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.4: “How can nuns wear jewellery? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear jewellery?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.11: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.13: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.14.1: ‘If a nun wears jewellery, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.6: what goes on the head, what goes around the neck, what goes on the hands, what goes on the feet, what goes around the hips.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.8: if she wears it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.2: if she does it because she is sick;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.5: The fourth training rule is finished.
